result.execSummary:
The defendant Leah O Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leah O Jones in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Plea hearing proceeds on the Record.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.

Sentencing hearing proceeds on the Record.

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statements by: ISABELL J.

Defendant sentenced to serve 3 (THREE) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of probation on 14CM4903.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Defendant was not produced.  Per Counsel for the Defense, matter adjourned for sentencing in Br. 33.  Sentencing hearing calendared for 10-26-2015 at 01:30pm.  sdg

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, Defendant Leah O Jones not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case adjourned for Status of Counsel in Branch 33. Defendant has a pending case in Branch 33. Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Leah O Jones not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Leah O Jones not in court, in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court with 14CM4903.  Court ordered case adjourned to Br 33.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Leah O Jones in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Morgan Wilz, appears as intern for the state under the student practice rule under the supervision of  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea hearing.  Statements by defense counsel that defendant has a pending felony in another county and is scheduled to resolve 7-13-2015.  Defense requests a date after 7-13-2015.  No objection by the state.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45. 

Court reviews Justice Point violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time.  Plea/Schedule scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Leah O Jones in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over discovery.  Justice Point violation addressed.  Case  passed.  
Case recalled at 11:34. Same appearances.  
Court admonishes Defendant.  Defense requests a projected guilty plea date. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Ruslan Z

Defendant Leah O Jones in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Defendant Leah O Jones in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
